Posts.EditableText:
I tried to upload my game that was created in Twine, it is here: 
```http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/qcflogfhg0aw9of1lbgrdg/civilisation-b```
For some reason though no matter how many times I try to publish it to everyone though it gust stays as unlisted and doesn't even ask the questions like it is supposed to, I have tested the game and it does run properly so I don't know what to do...

Also, I tried to uploaded it twice (as separate games) thinking maybe the first one was broken...

Posts.EditableText:
It will stay unlisted until a mod approves it. For that to happen they have to play test it to check it's worthy of the category you've suggested.

Taken a quick look at your game and you're off to a bad start by admitting the game has grammar and spelling errors. The fact that Twine doesn't have a spell check is no real excuse as you can run spell checks online. Poor grammar is one of the things that will keep it unlisted.

Posts.EditableText: That's not correct, OurJud. Unlisted games can't be categorized by a mod. And grammar or spelling is not the important  point to keep it unlisted nor to put it into the sandpit. There seems to be a technical problem

Posts.EditableText: I ran into this problem recently. Make sure your browser accepts Javascript from... fb.me I think it was? (Also aspnetcnd.com, and akamaihd.net.) Are you running NoScript or equivalent, by any chance?
